other_tests.findings: Flap was cyanotic with 600 cc of serosanguineous fluid output; later determined to be venous outflow obstruction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Flap appearance did not improve postoperatively despite treatment; some improvement noted after releasing sutures and initiating leech therapy, ultimately leading to healing on postoperative day 12.

other_tests.findings: 4 units of packed red blood cells were given, raising hematocrit to 30.6% and systolic blood pressure to 120-130 mmHg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial hypotension improved but was insufficient to improve flap appearance; systemic hypoperfusion likely contributed to partial flap loss.
